CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 15, 1945, pg. 11, reads: "Resume Classes - Forty-five pupils of the Faith Evangelical Lutheran School, located at 3300 Webster Avenue, resumed classes Sept. 4. This Christian day school is fully accredited with State and city educational standards, and teaches from the first to the sixth grades.  The seventh and eighth grades will be added to the system next year.  The school, now in its third year, is under the supervision of Delbert E. Knack.  God's word as foundation for all teaching, and as the best possible training for useful Christian life is stressed by the teachers. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of children from first to sixth grades, and three men, including Delbert Knack and Pastor Steiner, posed on steps outside wooden Faith Evangelical Lutheran Church School, 3300 Webster Avenue, Hill District
